column5: Hoepfully the dollar holds up, wifey is starting to bend with the idea of upgrading my boat for 2012

As I originally stated.. I got a $300 cheque (and one for even more at .5% of gross sales).. for every Ontario Corp # that I own. Has nothing to do with personal HST/GST help cheques that people get.. These $300 cheques were sent to every business in Ontario(with no fanfair or announcement) to help offset the costs of upgrading electronics and invoices etc to reflect HST vs Gst and Pst.
I have an Ontario Corp # and received it as well.
I am enlightened, I didn't realize the hst scmoozle was written to businesses as well, you can my $300 back in heartbeat to get rid of the tax

For shopping its a good thing but we just lost another 30 drivers here where I work as our company opened another yard in the Detroit area just to save $$$ last year we had over 100 drivers here in Chatham but were at 69 now  a couple years ago we were at 120 in Chatham and around 40 in Barrie/Aliston but they are all gone the rising $$$ sucks to keep us working in Canada the longer it stays high the more jobs head south.

Just came across this deal on a glass multi species boat.  Pretty solid deal, especially with the dollar and you could prolly knock a $1000 off..  https://www.walleyecentral.com/classified/new/adviewer.jsp?adv=12910  Yes, it's a tracker.  I want a ranger.
We're looking at a Merc Benz GLK350.  CDN MSRP = 43,500 US MSRP = $35,500  Just investigating warranty
Damn expensive daylight running lights MS !

Working on getting the Admiral's consent on this one, 4.9 hours on the engine, cushions still in the plastic, virtually new for 10 grand or more less than a new one here.  http://www.boattrader.com/listing/2006-Trophy-1802-WA-96688746
With a 135 hp outboard I think it may be underpowered.

You'll have to pay duty as well, not sure if its made in north america or not, but it doesn't matter, most of the parts will be made overseas (NAAFTA) And yeah, the daytime running lights will cost you a bundle, nevermind the recall letter.  Take it from a guy thats brought hundreds of vehicles over. I will NEVER bring another mercedes across the border.....,mercedes customer service in canada are a bunch of aholes to deal with if you never bought it from a canadian dealer.
135 is the max rating , from test reports I would think 40mph, fine for what I want. Most I've seen have 90's or 115's, the bigger motor was a plus for this listing.
OH, that's great....just looks heavy....one of my fishing partners has a 18.5' Lund with a 115 Yammy so I thought it might be under powered. That is a glass boat, right ?
My Ranger with 150 does 55 mph with a 14.5X 23pitch SS 3 blade set up for holeshot so he is right in line for H.P. versus weight.   Art
is that $1.10 US or CAN?

I purchased my last vehicle is the states.Daytime running lights cost me $90 as they were a computer flash over,no big deal.The recall letter ...as muchh as they tell you that it is only available through one orginization I got mine from one of the dealerships over there for nothing other than a smile and a thankyou.
Was it a Mercedes?
No it was a high end truck
OH, then is was a TUNDRA...
Wish I had the money to invest in some property down south.  Know a few guys that are.  Just a heads up.  Bendix in Toronto is exchanging at par.
Ordered off ebay the other day and paid less than the US amount

Doesn't help that US bank account of mine much.. nor the piles of aircraft parts I have here bought at 1.38 to 1.48 on the dollar in years past. Guess I'll close the doors and go on vacation...'till armageddon hits.  Dollar at par won't help our Ontario Manufactures get contracts either..
..but it will help them invest in new technology and greater efficiency.  now explain to me why the price at the pump isn't going down since oil is priced in U$.

We are probably going to see $1.05 Canadian over U.S. at some point this year, if not more. Wayne, get ready for more pain this year. Unfortunately, manufacturing in Ontario is continuing to be hollowed out. The US needs to have a cheap greenback to get their economy going again.

Wayne you may wanna talk to your accountant ... do the conversion to CDN and write off the loss (then buy back if you actually need it)... PM me and I'll tell you about how I do the conversion for less than quarter of a penny.

.. I'd rather just go on Vacation Jon !! LOL  I'm already "creating income".. to get rid of losses available for future years that are going to be too old. Anyone that retires from aviation with a bit of money started with a LOT !!
Don't forget, we now have the HST to help out our small business and manufacturing, it will all work out in the end
Hey moemoe... I got my "help" check for $300 to help with the change over to HST... for every Ontario # that I own. Of course I have to claim it as income on the 2010/2011 T2 return !!!
*SMILES*
Last I checked, you guys gain a couple cents on our Dollar.   My trips up north are getting a little more $$$$

Here ya go Phil http://www.zillow.com/homedetails/Ballplay-Rd-Madisonville-TN-37354/2132448270_zpid/  google the area and expand the map, there is some water in the area and it rarely ever freezes. Of course you might have to learn how to catch bass? The southern way. LOL

I remember it being either 1974 or 1975 and I believe it was 4 cents on a dollar...  This is looking to be year 2 that I don't head north for a fishing trip....unless I hit it BIG in VEGAS...the adult playground of the world.  Bob

It's tough when we come up to Canada we never know if we should keep the Canadian money we acquire or change it back to dollars year to year. The good news is y'all are worth up to $1.10 in my book.  Art
Ha!  I'll have to get an orange hat with a T on it and some balloon bobbers.  This is more what friends are investing in HERE

I here ya Wayne ...  was just browsing the homes in Surprise Arizona .. where the cost of homes is about$45/sq ft !!! Its crazy ...You can get a 3200 sq ft home for under $150,000 (and on a golf course) !
Do they call it Surprise for a reason?
..and on an airstrip as well Jon.. Park the truck.. walk thru the house, out to the hangar.. taxi out and go play. Like I said.. I'm lookin....
Hmmmm, warm dry climate. I think I know where your heads at.
The only problem Chris.. Logistics !

That orange hat with a T served Bill Dance well for a lot of years! Not hard to find a decently priced home, http://www.trulia.com/property/3025981088-116-Brooklyn-Cir-Madisonville-TN-37354  And there are a lot of 10-30 thousand acre lakes in the area.
Time to look for a used boat in the US!

I am pretty sure I was looking at eligible taxes and your hst cheque is exempt, good ole daulton!  this quote was taken from the revenue canada site  "21. Is the OSTTB a taxable benefit? No. The OSTTB payments are non-taxable" osttb=ontario sales tax transition benefit

Is that for personal returns moemoe??.. or business??  I guess when it comes right down to it it will go in the HST refund ledger to offset HST paid out... but either way you look at it.. it becomes income for a business.

The hst cheque is written to individuals not businesses, so I guess this is for your personal income and wouldn't be sent to business ie Irishfield Aviation, Therefore it would not be a claimed expense. I am not a business owner but wouldn't your business claim be separate from your personal or family income tax?
